none: Brick House - The Hardness War demo 1989
Brick House - The Hardness War demo 1989

Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on August 26, 2016 Description from Terminal Escape:
Meaty late'80s Philadelphia hardcore, BRICK HOUSE sound exactly like you think they should. In a different world, this band is playing reunion shows at east coast HC festivals and the boys are going wild, singing What's it gonna take for you to wise up // Don't put down our city, 'cause we've had enough (from "Suburban And Scared"). Four tracks, meaty and determined. Some of the bits are warbled, but the shit is 27 years old and has been (appropriately) partied on. Get it. THE HARDNESS WAR
https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jRZgFxG0YS4/V8BYAr_a2XI/AAAAAAAAPik/tkxoQvs0IW08rYjSy967cR1LkvIQio0RwCLcB/s1600/Brick%2BHouse%2Boutside%2Bcopy.jpg https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ME7nJJr77m0/V8BOhsDZTJI/AAAAAAAAPiY/0tWvt2H5wrUx893qQmN5scyf21hCHr1KQCEw/s1600/Brick%2BHouse%2Bfront%2Bcopy.jpg
